name: Worthier-title doctrine abolished
text: §560:2-710  Worthier-title doctrine abolished.  The doctrine of worthier title is abolished as a rule of law and as a rule of construction.  Language in a governing instrument describing the beneficiaries of a disposition as the transferor's "heirs", "heirs at law", "next of kin", "distributees", "relatives", or "family", or language of similar import, does not create or presumptively create a reversionary interest in the transferor. [L 1996, c 288, pt of §1]
